line_1: Then a' that kent him round declar'd,
line_2: It pat me fidgean-fain to hear't,

line_1: Then a' that kent him round declar'd,
line_2: An' sae about him there I spier't;

line_1: Then a' that kent him round declar'd,
line_2: That nane excell'd it, few cam near't,

line_1: When, at his Death, the humble Man declar'd,
line_2: He wish'd thus privately to be Interr'd.

line_1: But ah! too soon his looks success declared,
line_2: Too late her loss the marriage-rite repair'd;

line_1: Her conscious tail her joy declared;
line_2: The fair round face, the snowy beard,

line_1: Here oft Her Silence had Her Heart declar'd.
line_2: Here oft the Nymph His breathing Vows had heard:
That he for Beef and Pudding car'd.

line_1: But e'er he half the Dauphins Will declar'd,
line_2: Seiz'd on my Hand, around like Madness star'd,
From such disgrace I had been spar'd,

line_1: So in my Conquest be Thy Might declar'd:
line_2: And, for Thy Justice, be Thy Name rever'd.
